DOC.brief_summary: Pain during intrauterine device (IUD) insertion can be a barrier to initiation. Misoprostol and nonsteroidal drugs have found to be ineffective by clinical trials.Investigators tested whether intracervical 2% lidocaine gel decreased insertion pain compared to placebo.
DOC.brief_title: Lidocaine 10% Spray Reduces Pain During Intrauterine Device Insertion
DOC.criteria: Age >18 Not pregnant Smear negative Chronic pelvic pain Pregnancy Uterine anomaly Fibroid Acute cervicitis Pelvic inflammatory disease Cervical stenosis
